snippet: After their ship was taken hostage at gunpoint, Iranian fishermen survived six weeks by relying on calm nerves, prayer, camaraderie and, in the end, duplicity.
abstract: Iranian fishermen survived their six week captivity by Somali pirates by relying on calm nerves, prayer, camaraderie and, in the end, duplicity; crew, led by experienced captain Mahmed Younes, surreptitiously dumped ship's diesel fuel while complying outwardly with the pirates, in hopes of hastening their release.
lead_paragraph: After their ship was taken hostage at gunpoint, Iranian fishermen survived six weeks by relying on calm nerves, prayer, camaraderie and, in the end, duplicity.

headline.seo: Iranians Tell of Six Weeks of Fear With Somali Pirates
headline.main: Bold Lie Turns Run-In at Sea Into Dramatic Rescue
headline.print_headline: Bold Lie Turns High-Seas Run-In Into Dramatic Rescue

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
